title: 114_hr384
content: The Act is titled the "Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act" and modifies provisions related to equal access to justice. The "Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act" amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code, requiring the Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States to report annually to Congress on fees and expenses awarded under this section. The report must detail the awards, claims, and other relevant information for evaluation. The "Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act" amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code, requiring the Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States to report annually to Congress on fees and expenses awarded under this section. The report must detail all payments of fees and expenses awarded, regardless of settlement agreement confidentiality, and maintain a searchable database online for each award. The "Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act" requires agencies to provide information on adversary adjudications, including agency names, claims, parties, award amounts, and justification for agency positions. The online database must comply with legal restrictions, and agencies must cooperate with the Administrative Conference Chairman for data collection. The "Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act" mandates agencies to disclose details of adversary adjudications, including agency names, claims, parties, award amounts, and justification for agency positions. The Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States must submit an annual report to Congress on fees and expenses awarded, including information on the awards, claims, and any relevant details to aid Congress in evaluating the impact of such awards. The report must be made available to the public online and account for all payments made under settlement agreements. The settlement agreement includes nondisclosure provisions. The Chairman of the Administrative Conference must report on fees and expenses awarded in each case, including amounts paid, award details, and the statute under which the plaintiff filed suit. A searchable online database will contain information on each award of fees and expenses. The Chairman of the Administrative Conference must report on fees and expenses awarded in each case, including case details, agency names, party names, claim descriptions, award amounts, and justification for agency positions. An online database will contain this information, excluding any prohibited by law or court order. Agencies must provide requested information to comply with reporting requirements. The Chairman must report on fees and expenses awarded in each case, including case details, agency names, party names, claim descriptions, award amounts, and justification for agency positions. Agencies must provide requested information to comply with reporting requirements. Section 2412 of title 28, United States Code, is amended to apply to awards of fees and expenses made after the enactment of this Act. Section 504(e) and 2412(d)(5) of title 5 and title 28, United States Code, require reports to be submitted by March 31 of the following calendar year. Online databases under section 504(f) and 2412(d)(6) must be established promptly after enactment, but no later than the deadline for the first reports.
